intro: Hieracium tortumense, commonly known as the mountain hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium tortumense is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
